maven2-moduleset.description:
This build: 1) Creates the application war file from the HEAD reference of the git master branch. 2) Wraps the war file into the image during its creation 3) Uploads the new image to a docker registry 4) Issues a command over SSH to docker on the application host to remove any existing container that is running and run a new one based on the new image.
ISSUE: If you see any node errors that mention "ECONNRESET or EPIPE", this is probably due to the following known bug: https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/7945 This issue is intermittent and not actually related to proxy configuration. Running the build again usually goes successfully.
TODO: Have a pre-build step build the other dependencies if they are not in the local .m2 repo. For example, if rice or s2sgen versions indicated in the pom file are not present, this could be detected by the following command: mvn dependency:get -Dartifact=g:a:v -o -DrepoUrl=file://path/to/your/repo

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: BRANCH
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: This value specifies any branch that has a ref matching the pattern specified here. For example, if you tagged a ref as follows: "git tag release/2015.3.1.R a2d8a71" Then this job would build kuali-research from ref "a2d8a71" To simply specify the HEAD ref of the master branch use: refs/heads/master

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: REFSPEC
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description:
Specifies references to pull must be tagged and the tag value must start with "release/" To instead pull the latest from the master branch use: +refs/heads/master:refs/remotes/origin/master
Tag the codebase accordingly. For example: git tag release/coeus-1603.49 tags/coeus-1603.49 git tag release/coeus-1603.49 HEAD git tag release/coeus-1603.49 a2d8a71 etc.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# Remove any dangling items if [ -n "$(docker images --filter dangling=true -q)" ] ; then docker rmi -f $(docker images --filter dangling=true -q); echo "Removed dangling image(s)"; else echo "No dangling images to remove"; fi if [ -n "$(docker ps --filter dangling=true -q)" ] ; then docker rm $(docker ps --filter dangling=true -q); echo "Removed dangling container(s)"; else echo "No dangling containers to remove"; fi if [ -n "$(docker volume ls -qf dangling=true)" ] ; then docker volume rm $(docker volume ls -qf dangling=true); echo "Removed dangling volume(s)"; else echo "No dangling volumes to remove"; fi
# Build the app image (the image will curl the jenkins war artifact into itself while it is building). docker build \ -f kuali_research_docker_file_bundlewar \ -t ec2-52-25-226-38.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com:5000/bu-ist/kuali-research-dind:v1.0 \ --build-arg JENKINS_URL=ec2-52-37-165-82.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com:8080/kc-dind \ https://github.com/whennemuth/hello-world.git#master:docker/build.context/kuali-research
# Push the newly created image to the registry (Assumes the directory containing the sa.crt file is mounted into this jenkins container). docker push ec2-52-25-226-38.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com:5000/bu-ist/kuali-research-dind:v1.0
# Execute a docker command over ssh on the application host to run a container against the new image in the registry ssh \ jenkins@ec2-52-37-253-82.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com \ -i /var/jenkins_ssh/ec2_rsa "set -x && docker ps && " \ "docker rm -f kcdindcontainer || echo 'No container to remove.' && " \ "docker pull ec2-52-25-226-38.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com:5000/bu-ist/kuali-research-dind:v1.0 && " \ "docker run" \ " -d" \ " -u root" \ " -p 80:8080" \ " -p 3306:3306" \ " --name kcdindcontainer" \ " -v /var/jenkins/kc/logs:/usr/local/tomcat/logs " \ "ec2-52-25-226-38.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com:5000/bu-ist/kuali-research-dind:v1.0 && " \ "docker ps"
